message.content:
Below is a worked‐through example of how one can “read” the target picture and match it, block‐by‐block and layer‐by‐layer, to the unrotated pieces in the dictionary.  I have broken the scene into two sub‐assemblies (“the truck” on the left and “the tower” on the right) and then listed all needed blocks and a suggested order of assembly.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1) ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

A. The “Truck” (Left Structure)
 • Total Blocks: 8  
 • Layers (from bottom to top):
   Layer 1:  
     – Two orange cylinders (the “wheels”).  
   Layer 2:  
     – A single flat yellow rectangular prism forming the truck’s base.  
   Layer 3:  
     – Three blocks side by side: a short green rectangular block, a blue cube, and a red cube.  
   Layer 4:  
     – Two yellow half‐cylinders sitting on top (one over the green block, one over the red cube).

B. The “Tower” (Right Structure)
 • Total Blocks: 10
 • Layers (from bottom to top):
   Layer 1:  
     – Two tall orange cylinders in front (pillars)  
     – Two more tall orange cylinders stacked in the rear (making a single tall column).  
   Layer 2:  
     – A yellow rectangular prism laid horizontally across the two front pillars.  
   Layer 3:  
     – A red arch on top of that yellow prism (toward the front).  
     – A yellow half‐cylinder behind the arch.  
     – A red cube behind/next to that half‐cylinder.  
   Layer 4:  
     – One orange wedge piece on top of the red cube.  
     – Another orange wedge piece capping the very tall orange column at the back.

Hence the entire scene uses 8 blocks on the truck and 10 on the tower, for a total of 18 blocks spread over roughly four layers in each sub‐assembly.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2) DICTIONARY‐BLOCK SELECTION
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

Below are all the dictionary indices needed, with how many times each occurs and where:

A. Truck (8 blocks)
 • 2× #9  (orange short cylinders) – the two wheels  
 • 1× #7  (yellow flat rectangular prism) – the truck’s base  
 • 1× #5  (green rectangular block) – left/top cargo section  
 • 1× #2  (blue cube) – center top  
 • 1× #4  (red cube) – right top  
 • 2× #10 (yellow half‐cylinders) – “domed” roof pieces

B. Tower (10 blocks)
 • 4× #8  (orange tall cylinders) – two front pillars + the double‐stacked rear column  
 • 1× #7  (yellow flat rectangular prism) – horizontal “bridge” across pillars  
 • 1× #1  (red arch) – on top of the yellow bridge  
 • 1× #10 (yellow half‐cylinder) – sitting behind/above the arch  
 • 1× #4  (red cube) – just behind the half‐cylinder  
 • 1× #15 (orange wedge) – roof piece on top of the red cube  
 • 1× #16 (orange wedge) – spire atop the tall rear column

Note that the same part‐number may appear multiple times (e.g. #8 is used four times).  All blocks must be used exactly as shown (no further rotating).

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3) SUGGESTED ASSEMBLY ORDER
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

Here is one logical, layer‐by‐layer sequence.  You may of course group steps differently as long as the final arrangement matches:

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 9   (first truck wheel)
  Step2:  Move block with index 9   (second truck wheel)
  Step3:  Move block with index 7   (truck’s long yellow base)
  Step4:  Move block with index 5   (green rectangular block on base)
  Step5:  Move block with index 2   (blue cube next to green)
  Step6:  Move block with index 4   (red cube next to blue)
  Step7:  Move block with index 10  (half‐cylinder atop the green block)
  Step8:  Move block with index 10  (half‐cylinder atop the red cube)

  -- now the tower --
  Step9:  Move block with index 8   (front left tall cylinder)
  Step10: Move block with index 8   (front right tall cylinder)
  Step11: Move block with index 8   (rear column bottom)
  Step12: Move block with index 8   (rear column top)
  Step13: Move block with index 7   (yellow rectangular bridge on front pillars)
  Step14: Move block with index 1   (red arch on bridge)
  Step15: Move block with index 10  (yellow half‐cylinder behind arch)
  Step16: Move block with index 4   (red cube behind half‐cylinder)
  Step17: Move block with index 15  (orange wedge roof piece atop red cube)
  Step18: Move block with index 16  (final orange wedge/spire atop the tall rear column)
}

Following these eighteen steps with the exact blocks (and orientations) listed will reproduce the target scene as shown.
